Review: I'll be reviewing the individual game, as well as each DLC here, there will be spoilers since I cant recommend this game if you know nothing. REBIRTH- I have played this version the least, but I know whats in it, and how you unlock it. For one the game is really fun off the bat, and most of the items have real uses, but heres the cool thing about this, and binding of isaac as a whole, synergies. If you grab one thing and then grab another, theres a chance it will synergize with it, creating something craaaazy. Like a exploding laser of doom. But in this version theres really only synergies with like 15 items. Which I guess makes sense, can you imagine having to code at least 600 synergies that some may never see? This is a pretty tight base game that can stand on its own 2 feet. AFTERBIRTH- this one I have no emotions on, it barely adds anything and the items it adds are pretty useless. The main thing this one adds is a new area with a new boss fight, as well as a new gamemode, but thats it. AFTERBIRTH+- This one is probably closest to being my least favorite, it adds MORE new items that suck, and it adds in a unfun area with reused assets, and a final boss so frustrating and unfun that it honestly makes me sick. ON TOP OF adding ANOTHER new game mode which is just a harder mode of the one we already SAW. It only has mod support going for it. REPENTANCE- This one brings it up by about 10,000 and adds a lot of new things. New areas that arent lazy and unoriginal? Yep, new bosses that are actually fun and fair (most of the time)? Yep, a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ new synergies for the new items on top of reworked items that sucked mega dong in the other versions? Yep, game actually being hard? Yep. yep, and yep. It even adds a lot of new characters, but you have to unlock them in a odd way, but its very worth it. While the final boss of afterbirth+ still makes me ask why I have to this every ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ time the new stuff added makes it all so much better. The big thing however are synergies, they have so many more synergies in this game then any other game. If you have 50 bucks to spare, just skip the others and get this one, and if you have been playing afterbirth+ for a while now and are getting sick of it, get this, it makes you feel like you're playing isaac for the first time again since 2011 or 2013 or whenever the hell you started playing.

Review: I just, dont know what to say. Its so good, its so addicting, but there is a couple issues that prevent me from saying this is the greatest game of our millennium and you should rob a bank to play it if you must. But first, the good. Holy ♥♥♥♥. Where do I begin? Everything about this is amazing, the visuals, the views, the time slowing stuff (which has a in game explanation, but thats MASSIVE spoiler territory.), the sounds, the story, its all just amazing. Theres even different game types and even characters! I actually wanna give an example of how the story very greatly ties in with the gameplay for a brief second. So In one level, you find a tape of a place you were at earlier in the game, in that location everyone was dead including the person you're trying to kill. And earlier after a very intense motorbike chase the guy you are about to kill is suddenly whisked away by someone with blonde hair, weird right? You don't know much, only that he calls himself "the dragon" which has been your nickname in news articles. So once you find the tape and watch it, you find out "The dragon" was the one who killed everyone earlier. And even cooler? YOU GET TO ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ PLAY AS HIM. And he even has a special ability you NEVER get to have in the game, not even after watching the tape. And its such a power trip Im surprised I didint die from being hard. Its such an ingenious way to tell the player just how powerful this guy really is, and how you cant even begin to live up to those standards. and another thing I wanna gush about, the bosses are just really good, if this were a cuphead style game where you kill mostly bosses I would love this game about as much as I do now. Theres only 3 (4 if you count the one im not sure is beatable) bosses, and all of them are fantastic, and the buildup to said bosses and payoff is so great every time. now for the stuff I didint think was as great. 1. Sometimes the controls respond a bit later then you expect, now I dont know if its always like this since I only noticed in the last levels, but sometimes when I push the dodge button, you'd expect the DODGE button to activate immediately right? No, it just doesent sometimes. 2. The game has the worlds most abrupt ending in the history of abrupt endings. You just kill a bunch of people, game ends. Thats it. And its kinda ♥♥♥♥♥♥ cause theres alot of loose ends that are just not explained. But it is safe to assume that most will be explained in the upcoming DLC, one which I still wonder if we actually have a name for yet. 3. Theres not enough bosses, 3 is simply too little for me, especially with how masterfully made they are. 4. The game in general is really ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ short. See those 4 hours at time of review? Thats how long the game is, and most of my time was spent ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ around and dying. And speaking of 5. The game is just a bit too easy, I havent played the hardmode yet, so I may eat my words, but most of my deaths were cause I was ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ around and dying because of it, of course I dont know how to make the game harder without making it ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, other than more bosses and tougher enemies maybe. I just wish it were slightly harder. and thats about it, most of the stuff I complained about is subjective, except maybe #1. but that could just have been me not releasing till that point. So objectively this game is perfect. Buy it, just do it. Im not giving you a choice, if you arent convinced yet how are you even human?

The graphic novel style is completley abandoned, the only one that even slightly calls back to it is parts in cutscenes where theres a letterbox then one part freezes, best I could compare it to is a animated comic book, if that makes sense. And this also makes cutscenes unremarkable. In the first max payne I always remembered what max had to say in each cutscene because of the style in which it was delivered. The constant VFX in cutscenes are really sickening. Best thing I can compare it to is if the gorillaz tranz video was a cutscene. It just feels like an attempt to make it seem memorable (even though they could've done that if they'd just kept the graphic novel style but ok) I dont care if its cause we're in maxes head, the graphic novel style was the same thing, but that was different from other games, and not just Mocap cutscenes. Max never shuts the ♥♥♥♥ up, and almost has nothing to add. In the first game max would always have something to say, but only in cutscenes, and his writing was fantastic. In this game Max never shuts up, and he only says ♥♥♥♥ that infants could figure out in the womb. Like a ammo box later in the game, max goes "Oh look a box, I would say its a coincidence that this factions ammo crate was in this factions area was a coincidence but I write ♥♥♥♥ off too often" like what does that add? It just feels like the writing team wanted to flex their muscles but passed out and fell into a fire pit, so they hired last minute replacements. Game feels generic with the setting, a old veteran of ♥♥♥♥ going to a different country but it doesent turn out well? If you just change a few things in that summary you get Far cry 3, compared to the first game with the new york setting, noire style, and graphic novel cutscenes, compared to the third games random country that isint USA setting, action hero style, and generic mocap/CGI cutscenes. Do i recommend it?: yes. The gameplay is simply too good to pass up, but just know the story is ass.

Backtracking is fine but when your map has poor boundaries it gets annoying having to guess the way back rolf a few humans you meet along the way are there for, well, no reason at all. Review: After 100% completing this game this is what I have to say. Chernobylite is a really story rich linear sandbox survival game that has you in the shoes of a scientist named Igor searching for your wife Tanya in a post apocalyptic Chernobyl. While playing the game you look for clues surrounding your long lost wife that you see in visions. These clues allow you to run simulations of past events. It's a cool idea but simply just dialogue, (I wish it would've been interactive). You scavenge for supplies for your base, companions and weapon upgrades. Every decision made will affect your companions, game play and ending of the game. You can alter your decisions later on by visiting the memory timeline if you so happen to mess up, which is a really nice feature. The NAR are your main enemy throughout the game, which also happen to be the cause of this apocalypse. In addition of this apocalypse are the shadows which can be found out in the wild. The shadows don't really pose much of a threat and are easy enough to handle. This game offers stealth to take down enemies but it isn't really the best, I've been sandwiched by two guards while hidden in a bush multiple times, crouching and hiding in the bushes is the extent of the stealth system in this game unfortunately. Levelling up is easy enough. You level up by completing quests, killing enemies, upgrading weapons, upgrading your base and gathering materials. While roaming around there's almost always side quests which is also another way of levelling up your character. Each level gives you a skill point and each companion has their own skill tree. These companions can be sent on scavenge quests. Companions all have their unique traits and are only useful to you if equipped with the right gear. Something to mention which I find quite cool is the worry of underfeeding you and your companions which will lower morale. Also some of the base upgrades will affect your companions quality of life. The difficulty settings don't really do much apart from increase the amount of enemies and their health, there also isn't really any reward for playing a higher difficulty either which can be seen as a good or bad thing. Weapons in this game aren't really that interesting to use apart from the energy weapons which you unlock later on. There are quite a lot of bugs in this game as well as a lack of polish in some places but not enough to ruin the experience as a whole. I had a blast playing this game and it basically replaced my life for a few days so I highly recommend this game. I got this game for cheap at $21 but it is easily worth the full price.

Review: Outlast is great. The atmosphere is really compelling and the story is simplistic but the real horror is that what takes place in Outlast could actually happen which is what makes it scary. In fact it's based off of real life events. To add to this it has a really good score which really adds a lot of value to the game, it implies what the main character is feeling and without it, it would really take away from the horror. In terms of game play, people may not like it but I think the fact you're completely incapable of defending yourself from the variants and your only option is to run and hide, it really makes you feel vulnerable. Without the feeling this game wouldn't work anywhere near as well, in fact I'd go as far as saying it wouldn't of been the success it is without it. For anyone playing for the first time, I seriously recommend playing on the Nightmare difficulty, I think it's the definitive way of playing this game. Normal difficulty takes a lot away from the horror since it's quite hard to die, where as Nightmare makes enemies have an improved sense of hearing, they inflict more damage and run faster. This makes it an actual challenge to escape each encounter and I wish I would've played on Nightmare difficulty on my first play through. Also I'd recommend the DLC and replaying a few times at least. I noticed so many new things that I didn't initially pick up the first couple of times. If you haven't already played Outlast and you love everything horror I strongly recommend it, I don't think you'll regret it. Also make sure you have a change of pants in case you soil yourself, I sure did when I first played.
